thread.title: Samarth Dwivedi, Aman Raj make cut
thread.title_full: Samarth Dwivedi, Aman Raj make cut - The Times of India

author: Ajit Bezbaruah
title: Samarth Dwivedi, Aman Raj make cut
text:
HONG KONG: Samarth Dwivedi and Aman Raj made the cut battling rough winds while India's top amateur Viraj Madappa, Priyanshu Singh, compatriots Karandeep Kochar and Veer Ahlawat all fell by the wayside after the second round in the 7th Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship (AAC) at the picturesque Clearwater Bay Golf & Country Club here on Friday. 

Ranked 123rd in the World Amateur Golf Rankings, the 23-year-old Dwivedi started off with a bogey and a birdie on the first two holes. The western India amateur champion then went on to add a double bogey (on the 12th), four bogeys (on the 5th, 11th, 15th and 17th holes) against just three birdies (on the 7th, 10th and 16th holes) but still managed to qualify for the weekend on the strength of his first round show to finish at par-140 in his maiden appearance in this tournament. 

Aman, runners-up in the western India ama eur, on his second appearance in this tournament, also had a double bogey on the 12th and compensated for the three bogeys on the 1st, 6th and 17th holes by sinking triple birdies in the 7th, 9th and 11th holes to finish tied 49 with twoover-142 and kept himself occupied for the week end. He finished tied 51st last year in Melbourne with scores of 78-75-74-77. 

Priyanshu, who closed Day 1 at tied 4th with 5under after 14 holes finished Round One at par af er four bogeys in the final four holes. Further bogeys on the 3rd, 12th, 13th and 18th and a double bogey on the 17th meant that he gave away yester day's advantage and finished tied 63rd with 4over-144 and miss the cut which fell at three-over and the top 60 players and best ties qualifying.
